Book an AppointmentRequest a Call Back

The mission of the Hope Spine Institute is to offer patients who are afflicted with illnesses of the spine and persistent pain access to the most cutting-edge medical and surgical care available. Patients are offered treatment in the form of high-quality medical services that are designed to repair, maintain, and improve their overall health. In order to assist patients in living a life free of pain, the Spine Clinic makes use of cutting-edge technology, up-to-date procedures, and cutting-edge therapies.

Patients who suffer from illnesses of the spine and chronic pain can take advantage of the department’s cutting-edge medicinal and surgical treatment options. In order to assist patients in living a life free of pain, it makes use of cutting-edge technology, up-to-date procedures, and innovative forms of treatment. The institute is a comprehensive spine surgery unit that collaborates closely with occupational and physical therapists to develop individual treatment plans for each patient. These treatment plans take into account the patient’s diagnosis as well as their lifestyle and the demands of their professional lives.


We are the premier facility in KR Puram, Bangalore, for spinal cord surgery and cervical spine care.

Hope spine surgery facilities are among the most advanced in Bangalore, and the country’s medical professionals provide superior diagnoses.

The Hope Hospital KR Puram, Bangalore location is widely regarded as our premier facility for cervical spine surgery, as well as spinal cord surgery, spine therapy and care, and care for a variety of disorders connected to the spinal cord. The hospital is acknowledged today for its competence and experience in the treatment of difficult spinal diseases. This is due in large part to the fact that it is led by some of the greatest spine surgeons in India. We are the best spine surgery hospital in Bangalore because we have the finest spine surgeons in the city and a staff of devoted professionals that bring a wealth of experience and extensive knowledge to the table. This has allowed us to grow into the best spine surgery hospital in KR Puram, Bangalore.

Conditions we treat

  • Arthritis
  • Bulging disc
  • Chiari malformation
  • Compression fracture
  • Degenerative disc disease
  • Foot drop
  • Herniated disc
  • Lower back pain
  • Neck pain
  • Osteoporosis
  • Piriformis syndrome
  • Radiculopathy
  • Sciatica
  • Scoliosis
  • Spinal stenosis
  • Spinal tumor
  • Spinal vascular malformation
  • Spondylolisthesis
  • Spondylosis
  • Synovial cyst
  • Syringomyelia

Choices for non-surgical therapy

Spine physiatry 

They have received specialized training in the evaluation and treatment of diseases associated with the back and spine. When treating some patients with spine physiatry, it may be necessary to do accurate spinal injections while the patient is being seen by an X-ray machine.

Pain management: 

Medication and other therapies that relieve pain, such as physical therapy or massage, can help improve your quality of life by allowing you to continue with your normal activities. By participating in our program, you will be linked with noninterventional pain management physicians and experts who have received specialized training.

Diagnostic services (imaging, lab)

Rehabilitative measures, such as:

  • physiotherapy (Physical)
  • Physical therapy for the spine Spine physical therapists have specialized training in treating disorders connected to the spine. They will analyze your condition, guide you through exercise, and educate you so that you can restore lost function and experience less discomfort.
  • Rehabilitation via occupation
  • Ergonomics and occupational specialty treatment
  • Evaluation of one’s functional capabilities
  • Aquatics

Integrative Medicine –

Acupuncture is one kind of complementary and alternative medicine that dates back to ancient China and has its origins in the biophysical concept of health care. When you come to Aurora, our experienced acupuncturists will inject extremely small needles into your skin in order to activate the body’s natural healing reaction. This can help reduce the painful physical, emotional, and mental symptoms that are connected with back pain. A related technique that takes a more biological approach, dry needling is a method in which physical therapists utilize acupuncture needles to reduce the physical symptoms of back pain.

Chiropractic therapy: 

Chiropractors who have received specialized training in spine manipulation are able to personalize your treatment to your individual spinal condition, which can help to lessen or eliminate back pain entirely.

Craniosacral therapy 

is a form of touch therapy that is used to heal and improve the craniosacral system. This system consists of the membranes and fluids that surround the brain and spine. Craniosacral therapy is used to treat and improve the craniosacral system.

Massage treatment: Massage can help reduce back pain by reducing tension and stiffness in the muscles, as well as boosting blood flow to the area that is suffering from pain.

Behavioral health: Since the mind and body are so closely linked, mental and emotional stress can lead to back problems. This is a topic that falls under the purview of behavioral health. Working with a psychologist who specializes in behavioral health and pain management to improve the person’s emotional and mental health is the best way to get rid of most back pain.

Interventional pain: 

If less invasive treatments haven’t worked, anesthesiologists who have completed a pain fellowship may use X-ray-guided spinal injections to treat chronic spinal pain. For example, an epidural injection is a type of spinal injection that might help relieve the pain of chronic pain.

Options for surgical therapy

Surgical treatment of the spine

Microdiscectomy 

A microdiscectomy is a type of minimally invasive surgery in which the surgeon makes a small window in your bone (lamina) in order to remove the herniated disc that is putting pressure on a spinal nerve. This procedure is also known as a laminotomy. It is helpful to get rid of the damaged part of the disc so that you can feel better.

Anterior cervical discectomy and fusion (ACDF):   

Following the removal of the disc, a spacer will be implanted in order to provide more room for your nerves. Plates are inserted into the bones above and below, and a graft is used to fuse the bones together so that they may be connected with each other.

Laminectomy:

 It is a surgery done to relieve pressure on the spinal cord and nerves. In order to make more room in the spinal canal, we must first remove the lamina, which is a component of the vertebrae. In light of the fact that this procedure has the potential to render the spine less stable, a spinal fusion may be carried out concurrently.

Lumbar spinal fusion:

The surgeon will remove the injured disc from between the vertebrae, and then the vertebrae that are above and below it will be fused together to provide stability.

Minimally invasive spine surgery (MISS): 

The term “minimally invasive spine surgery” (MISS) refers to an operation that is meant to do as little damage as possible to the natural tissue that surrounds the spine. This makes it possible for patients to recover from surgery more quickly, with less scar tissue and less discomfort. There are a lot of different kinds of MISS. Fewer incisions are made, and smaller devices are used in many cases, both of which contribute to the formation of smaller scars.

Kyphoplasty: 

Kyphoplasty is a minimally invasive technique that can be used to assist in reducing pain for individuals who have sustained a compression fracture. This procedure is carried out with the help of X-rays. In order to compensate for part of the height that was lost due to the fracture, a balloon is inflated. After that, the physician injects bone cement into the vertebrae in order to stabilize them.

Vertebroplasty: 

During a surgery called vertebroplasty, your doctor will inject a medical-grade substance called “bone cement” into a cracked vertebra to fix it. This is an attempt to take away some of the pain caused by the break.

Robotic spine surgery: 

Spine surgery that employs robotic assistance to let a surgeon visualize different parts of the spine is referred to as “robotic spine surgery.” During a fusion surgery, an arm controlled by a robotic system helps the surgeon put screws in the spine in the right place.

Should you be worried about your back and neck pain?

Even the most routine activities in life can become difficult to perform if you are experiencing back or neck pain, and if your discomfort along your spine is persistent or severe, this may indicate that there is a more significant underlying issue. You can examine your spine function, pain symptoms, and risk factors with the aid of our back and neck pain quiz, and depending on the answers, you’ll get some ideas about what steps to take next.

Look up a spinal specialist in your area.

The Hope Hospital spine services make it simpler for you to go back to the activities and responsibilities that are most important to you. You will be linked to an integrated team of specialists who will all work together on your individualized treatment plan. This will be accomplished through the use of a single entry point as well as your own care coordinator.

When should I go to the doctor about my aching back or neck?

Back and neck discomfort often improves without treatment. In the meantime, you can try some self-care measures, including taking an over-the-counter pain reliever, resting, and applying cold or heat to the affected area. However, if you suffer from any of the following, you should make an appointment with your doctor:

  • Injury pain after a vehicle crash, fall, or other trauma
  • Paralysis or numbness of the limbs
  • Experiencing pain and other symptoms like fever or weight loss without explanation
  • Involuntary bowel or bladder movement
  • Constant, severe discomfort
  • Consistent suffering despite self-administered care

 

To what kind of doctor should I go if I need spinal treatment?

Even though many of them also practice non-surgical medicine, many spine experts are surgeons. While neurosurgeons specialize in operating on the central nervous system, orthopedic surgeons tend to the musculoskeletal system. Spine care fellowships are available for both orthopedic and general doctors.

More and more hospitals are becoming “integrated facilities,” which means they employ interdisciplinary teams to treat patients. Aside from general physicians, patients may also see specialists, including anesthesiologists, physiatrists, radiologists, rheumatologists, and occupational and physical therapists.

 

How will my back or neck discomfort be handled?

Non-invasive treatments, including rest, ice, compression, and elevation, are typically used before more invasive procedures like surgery. An epidural steroid injection can decrease inflammation and alleviate pain for a few months if nothing else helps.

Surgery is rarely necessary and is only performed after all other therapeutic options have been exhausted. Thankfully, minimally invasive techniques have advanced to the point that many types of spine surgery may be performed.

 

What characteristics are important to seek in a spine surgeon?

The choice of a spine surgeon is a serious matter, so it pays to do your homework. To be sure your surgeon is highly qualified, it’s best to find one who has both board certification and fellowship training. It’s also important to look for a surgeon who is skilled in minimally invasive surgery and has extensive expertise in treating your specific illness.
